summaryText: Today Pastor Travis Hearn delivered an incredible message about building a 'match made in heaven' through intentional, Christ-centered relationships! Pastor Travis breaks down the reality that perfect marriages don't exist, but marriages built on biblical principles can be extraordinary. He candidly discusses how marriages require continuous work, communication, and commitment. The sermon tackles some challenging topics like sex, communication, and relationship dynamics with both humor and biblical wisdom. Pastor Travis isn't afraid to get real about the challenges couples face, emphasizing that true love isn't about infatuation, but about choosing to serve and love your partner daily. The most powerful takeaway? A match made in heaven isn't magically dropped from the sky, but carefully constructed on earth through intentional choices, Christ-like communication, and maintaining romance. Whether you're single, dating, or married, this message offers practical, biblical insights into creating meaningful, lasting relationships.
mainPoints: Keep the romance alive in your relationship
Build your relationship on biblical foundations

versesMentioned.text: For this reason a man shall leave his father and his mother and be joined to his wife, and they shall become one flesh.

Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails.
Let your fountain be blessed, and rejoice in the wife of your youth. A loving doe, a graceful deer—may her breasts satisfy you always, may you ever be intoxicated with her love.
Marriage should be honored by all, and the marriage bed kept pure, for God will judge the adulterer and all the sexually immoral.

The husband should fulfill his marital duty to his wife, and likewise the wife to her husband. The wife does not have authority over her own body but yields it to her husband. In the same way, the husband does not have authority over his own body but yields it to his wife. Do not deprive each other except perhaps by mutual consent and for a time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer. Then come together again so that Satan will not tempt you because of your lack of self-control.
The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.
My dear brothers and sisters, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry.
Husbands, love your wives and do not be harsh with them.
A quarrelsome wife is like the dripping of a leaky roof in a rainstorm; restraining her is like restraining the wind or grasping oil with the hand.

Monday.action: Choose one relationship (spouse, family member, friend) and make a deliberate effort to communicate with them in a loving, patient manner. Listen more than you speak and seek to understand their perspective.
Monday.prayer: Lord, teach me to love intentionally. Help me to communicate with grace, patience, and genuine care. Show me how to reflect Your love in my relationships today. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Ephesians 4:29: 'Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.'
Tuesday.action: Write a heartfelt note of encouragement to your spouse, partner, or a significant relationship. Focus on affirming their strengths and expressing genuine appreciation.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, help me use my words to build up and not tear down. Give me wisdom to speak life and love into my relationships. Help me see others through Your eyes. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 5:18-19: 'May your fountain be blessed, and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth.'
Wednesday.action: Plan a surprise date or romantic gesture for your spouse/partner. If single, reflect on the qualities of love you want to cultivate in a future relationship.
Wednesday.prayer: God, help me keep romance and intentionality alive in my relationships. Show me practical ways to demonstrate love and commitment. Guide my heart in Your design for love. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 1 Peter 4:8: 'Above all, love each other deeply, because love covers over a multitude of sins.'
Thursday.action: Identify one area of potential conflict in a relationship and choose to respond with patience and understanding instead of defensiveness.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, teach me to love deeply and forgive quickly. Help me respond with grace when it's difficult. Fill me with Your patient and understanding spirit. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Colossians 3:13: 'Bear with each other and forgive one another if any of you has a grievance against someone. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.'
Friday.action: Reflect on any unresolved conflicts. Take a step towards reconciliation, whether through a conversation, a message, or prayer.
Friday.prayer: Heavenly Father, give me courage to extend grace. Help me let go of past hurts and approach relationships with a spirit of reconciliation. Guide my heart. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 1 Corinthians 13:4-5: 'Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud.'
Saturday.action: Do a personal inventory of your relationship habits. Identify one area where you can grow in patience, kindness, or selflessness.
Saturday.prayer: God, transform my understanding of love. Help me love more like You - selflessly, patiently, and without condition. Reshape my heart to reflect Your perfect love. Amen.
